intro: Phyllorkis lasiantha, commonly known as the narrow-leafed wallaby tree, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and pod fruits. The plant is known for its distinctive narrow, lance-shaped leaves and its ability to thrive in arid and semi-arid environments. It produces small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. The tree is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
